td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : left; background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px

tr.td: Additional information about the addiction

a.title: Legend for this format

description.value: This is the logical model of an addiction of a patient. Initially based on the input of the NIHDI. This model represents a known, suspected or resolved addiction. This models does not intend to represent a point-in-time observation of substance intake or related event or behaviour. In other words, this logical model represents the addiction condition, not an addiction-related event or observation.

short.value: A subject's addiction

definition.value: A record of a patient's addiction.

short.value: Logical id of this artifact

definition.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

comment.value: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

short.value: Metadata about the resource

definition.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A set of rules under which this content was created

definition.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

comment.value: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

isModifierReason.value: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

short.value: Language of the resource content

definition.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comment.value: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: The business identifier(s) for the addiction condition

definition.value: The business identifier(s) for the addiction condition - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track an addiction throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

short.value: The clinical status of the addiction - whether it is active, resolved...

definition.value: The clinical status of the addiction - whether it is active, resolved...

short.value: The verification status of the addiction - whether it is suspected, confirmed, etc.

definition.value: The verification status of the addiction - whether it is suspected, confirmed, etc.

short.value: The person that has/had the addiction

definition.value: The patient that has/had the addiction

short.value: The type of addiction

definition.value: Here the type of addiction will be specified (e.g. alcohol, drugs, medication). It SHOULD be expressed in a codified way (Valueset will be delivered by NIHDI).

short.value: The specific addiction substance or activity

definition.value: Here it is possible to further refine the addiction information e.g. when "narcotics" is indicated, this can specify the substance

short.value: The date when the addiction is being recorded or updated

definition.value: The date when the addiction is being recorded or updated

short.value: The time when the patient suffered or suffers from addiction

definition.value: The actual period this addiction was true. (e.g. used when a patient used to abuse alcohol) - or the beginning of addiction in case the addiction is still active

short.value: The actual time period of the addiction, if it is known

definition.value: The actual period of the addiction or the beginning of addiction in case the addiction is still active

short.value: A free text indication of the time period of addiction - e.g. "teenager", etc.

definition.value: A free text indication of the time period of addiction - e.g. as "teenager", "approx 5 years ago", etc

short.value: Quantifier of addiction e.g. number of cigarettes per day

definition.value: e.g. number of cigarettes per day

short.value: Whether the addiction is known to be under treatment

definition.value: Is this patient following a treatment for this addiction?

short.value: The links to the treatment(s) associated with this addition, if existing and known

definition.value: Is this patient following a treatment for this addiction? (In technical reality, this will be actually a Procedure instance that refers to the Addiction instance)

short.value: Participants that report the addiction

definition.value: Clinical parties or informers that participate in reporting the addiction

short.value: Person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

short.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true". (Reference)

short.value: The role or action that the person took - for example informer, recorder, verifier..

definition.value: To mark the performer as 'INF' (informer) - in case the addiction is reported by family

short.value: Additional information about the addiction

definition.value: Additional information about the addiction - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.

short.value: A subject's addiction

definition.value: A record of a patient's addiction.

short.value: The business identifier(s) for the addiction condition

definition.value: The business identifier(s) for the addiction condition - This is an optional attribute, used for example to track an addiction throughout its lifecycle, or across vaults.

short.value: The clinical status of the addiction - whether it is active, resolved...

definition.value: The clinical status of the addiction - whether it is active, resolved...

short.value: The verification status of the addiction - whether it is suspected, confirmed, etc.

definition.value: The verification status of the addiction - whether it is suspected, confirmed, etc.

short.value: The person that has/had the addiction

definition.value: The patient that has/had the addiction

short.value: The type of addiction

definition.value: Here the type of addiction will be specified (e.g. alcohol, drugs, medication). It SHOULD be expressed in a codified way (Valueset will be delivered by NIHDI).

short.value: The specific addiction substance or activity

definition.value: Here it is possible to further refine the addiction information e.g. when "narcotics" is indicated, this can specify the substance

short.value: The date when the addiction is being recorded or updated

definition.value: The date when the addiction is being recorded or updated

short.value: The time when the patient suffered or suffers from addiction

definition.value: The actual period this addiction was true. (e.g. used when a patient used to abuse alcohol) - or the beginning of addiction in case the addiction is still active

short.value: The actual time period of the addiction, if it is known

definition.value: The actual period of the addiction or the beginning of addiction in case the addiction is still active

short.value: A free text indication of the time period of addiction - e.g. "teenager", etc.

definition.value: A free text indication of the time period of addiction - e.g. as "teenager", "approx 5 years ago", etc

short.value: Quantifier of addiction e.g. number of cigarettes per day

definition.value: e.g. number of cigarettes per day

short.value: Whether the addiction is known to be under treatment

definition.value: Is this patient following a treatment for this addiction?

short.value: The links to the treatment(s) associated with this addition, if existing and known

definition.value: Is this patient following a treatment for this addiction? (In technical reality, this will be actually a Procedure instance that refers to the Addiction instance)

short.value: Participants that report the addiction

definition.value: Clinical parties or informers that participate in reporting the addiction

short.value: Person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".

short.value: Reference to person that performed the recording or reporting

definition.value: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true". (Reference)

short.value: The role or action that the person took - for example informer, recorder, verifier..

definition.value: To mark the performer as 'INF' (informer) - in case the addiction is reported by family

short.value: Additional information about the addiction

definition.value: Additional information about the addiction - this can be relevant history, any remarks by the patient or professional, etc.
